title: Passages from the English Notebooks, Complete
author: Hawthorne, Nathaniel
snippet: Our road to Rydal lay through Ambleside, which is certainly a very prettytown, and looks cheerfully in a sunny day. We saw Miss Martineau'sresidence, called "The Knoll," standing high up on a hillock, and havingat its foot a Methodist chapel, for which, or whatever place of Christianworship, this good lady can have no occasion. We stopped a moment in thestreet below her house, and deliberated a little whether to call on her;but concluded we would not.
